Problem:
Consider a linear transformation system driven by the transformation operator \\( T \\) which acts on a vector space and is defined by the matrix \\( M \\. The system evaluates the effect of applying a transformation \\( T(x) = Mx \\) on an initial vector \\( x_0 \\), where M is a constant matrix. We examine the system dynamics when subjected to another transformation \\( S(x) = Nx \\), where \\( N \\) is also a constant matrix, at different instances.

If we apply the transformation \\( S(x) = Nx \\) as an intervention at any time post initial transformation by \\( M \\), will the new state of the system take into consideration influences from both \\( M \\) and \\( N \\)?
Explanation: The application of \\( N \\) as an intervention brings its effect into the resultant state. Thus, the future state becomes dependent on both transformations and will evolve based on the composite effect of \\( M \\) and \\( N \\).
